Short: Medication Statement
Definition: Entry in a Medication Summary or overview.

Short: Common header for all patient-related data
Definition: Common header for all patient-related data

Short: Subject
Definition: Patient/subject information

Short: Business identifier for the object
Definition: Business identifier for the object

Short: Authorship
Definition: Resource authoring details

Short: Author
Definition: Author(s) by whom the resource was/were authored. Multiple authors could be provided.

Short: Date and time of authoring/issuing
Definition: Date and time of the issuing the document/resource by its author.

Short: Date and time of the last update to the resource
Definition: Date and time of the last update to the document/information

Short: Status of the resource
Definition: Status of the resource

Short: Reason for the current status of the resource.
Definition: Reason for the current status of the resource.

Short: Language
Definition: Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.

Short: Version
Definition: Business version of the resource.

Short: A narrative easy-to-read representation of the full data set, e.g. PDF-version of a document
Definition: A narrative easy-to-read representation of the full data set, e.g. PDF-version of a document

Short: Autogenerated human readable text created from all structured and unstructured information elements related to dosage and dosage instructions.
Definition: Autogenerated human readable text created from all structured and unstructured information elements related to dosage and dosage instructions.

Short: The current status of the taking of medicine.
Definition: The current status of the taking of medicine.

Short: The medication that is being administered or has been administered.
Definition: The medication that is being administered or has been administered.
Requirements: eHN PS Guideline, ISO IPS, MH@EU

Short: Coded or text reason for the prescription (typically diagnosis, or a procedure)
Definition: This is the reason why the medication is being prescribed or used. It provides a link to the Past or current health conditions or problems that the patient has had or has. [IPS].

Short: The intended use of the medication, e.g. prophylactic, therapeutic, diagnostic, anesthesia, etc.
Definition: The intended use of the medication, e.g. prophylactic, therapeutic, diagnostic, anesthesia, etc.

Short: Number of units per intake and frequency of intake over a specified duration of time
Definition: Number of units per intake and frequency of intake over a specified duration of time. Example: 1 tablet every 24h, for 10 days .
Requirements: eHN PS Guideline, ISO IPS, MH@EU

Short: Date when patient needs to start taking the medicine prescribed
Definition: Date when patient needs to start taking the medicine prescribed. This information may be expressed using start and end date times OR indicating the duration. The first is used to indicate a specified interval (e.g., from March 15th, 2017); the latter for indicating a 'floating' period (e.g., 2 weeks). In case of unbounded period (continuous therapy), the end element will be valued with an exceptional value.
Requirements: eHN PS Guideline, ISO IPS, MH@EU
